byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: The subsidiary, a large sports book runner in Las Vegas, agreed to pay about $22.5 million to settle accusations of illegal gambling and money laundering.

headline.print_headline: Cantor Fitzgerald Gaming Affiliate Reaches Settlement
headline.main: Cantor Fitzgerald Gambling Affiliate Settles Investigation

snippet: The subsidiary, a large sports book runner in Las Vegas, agreed to pay about $22.5 million to settle accusations of illegal gambling and money laundering....
abstract: Cantor Gaming, business affiliate of Cantor Fitzgerald, agrees to pay $22.5 million in nonprosecution deal with federal prosecutors to settle illegal gambling and money laundering accusations; business, financed by bond-trading powerhouse and one of biggest sports book runners, allegedly broke several federal and state laws, including allowing bets made by proxy and permitting bettors to make wagers from out of state.
